column5: Just out for a little strole across Lake St. Clair on his way to Toronto   https://uk.news.yahoo.com/man-rescued-walking-across-frozen-lake-canada-181426722.html#DUhz1BS
"Could have easily broken thru the ice and drowned" and there they are simply walking on the broken chunks from the tug! Doubtful... he almost made it .. lol

I never knew St.Clair was a great lake. Stupidity is a DNA thing, he can blame his parents. I have read a few accounts of a few misguided souls that purposely walked across Erie. I think one account was from a young man that crossed the western end in the 70's, successfully I might add. I believe I read it here last year. I wonder how many have tried and never lived to tell of it.
OK D/16 I give? I know that's the You know yer a redneck guy, but fill me in. Please.

Ah, the Here's Your Sign guy, not You Know Yer A Redneck when. I get it now, I like that guy. You know your a redneck when there's a ribbon cutting ceremony but the Mayor couldn't attend because the second cut of hay had to be taken in. When you go into a restaurant and he seater asks " Table for 2 guys?" Here's yer sign.  When did everyone become "guys"?
